absyn

Class CommandSeq

  • java.lang.Object
    • absyn.Absyn
      • absyn.Command
        • absyn.CommandSeq

  • public class CommandSeq
extends Command
    A node of abstract syntax representing a sequence of two commands. Local declarations are not visible after the sequence.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandSeq(int pos, Command first, Command second)
      Constructs the abstract syntax of a sequence of two commands.

    • Method Summary

      boolean checkForDeadcode()
      Checks that this conditional does not contain dead-code, that is, commands which can never be executed.
      Block translate(CodeSignature where, Block continuation)
      Translates this command into intermediate Kitten bytecode.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandSeq

        public CommandSeq(int pos,
                  Command first,
                  Command second)
        Constructs the abstract syntax of a sequence of two commands.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position in the source file where it starts the concrete syntax represented by this abstract syntax
        first - the first component of the sequence
        second - the second component of the sequence

    • Method Detail

      • checkForDeadcode

        public boolean checkForDeadcode()
        Checks that this conditional does not contain dead-code, that is, commands which can never be executed. It checks that there is no dead-code in any of the two commands. If the first command ends with a return, it issues an error.
        Specified by:
        checkForDeadcode in class Command
        Returns:
        true if and only if every execution path in both branches of the conditional ends with a return command

      • translate

        public Block translate(CodeSignature where,
                       Block continuation)
        Translates this command into intermediate Kitten bytecode. Namely, it translates the first command by using as continuation the translation of the second command by using the given continuation.
        Specified by:
        translate in class Command
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where this expression occurs
        continuation - the continuation to be executed after this sequence of commands
        Returns:
        the code executing this sequence of commands and then continuation
